conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, angled/isometric camera, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable room volumes; clean cutaway with multiple wall faces visible. Minor simplification and a few wall/edge terminations look slightly non-architectural.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and garage placement are broadly similar, but several plan-defined spaces (kitchen/laundry/balcony/WC separation) are simplified or not clearly represented; some internal partitions/door placements do not convincingly match the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Bedroom and lounge-like furniture present; bathroom has minimal fixtures. Kitchen, laundry, and second-bedroom cues are weak/absent or not identifiable, reducing room identity fidelity.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good legibility of walls/floors/openings; lighting is adequate. Some openings/doors are simplified and a few areas are sparse, making room-function inference harder.

detected_errors.description: Interior layout fidelity is reduced: kitchen/laundry/balcony and WC/bath differentiation from the 2D plan is not clearly preserved in the 3D model.
Door/window placements and/or counts appear simplified and may not align with the specific walls/openings shown in the 2D plan.
Key program furniture/fixtures (notably kitchen and laundry elements) are missing or insufficient to confirm correct room identities.

summary: This is a valid 3D cutaway conversion with good volumetric rendering, but it only moderately preserves the 2D plan’s detailed room layout and openings (notably kitchen/laundry/balcony and WC/bath definition).
